results.title: Weeping willow
results.creator_credit: Louise Woodruff Sanz, Nicholas Price, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
She once described his dancing as being like the wind through the willow trees. She was his mentor and his best friend. She was his mum. Weeping Willow is the story of a dancer coming to terms with the death of his closest friend and biggest fan. It documents their journey to the present and into the future.
Features Gary Lang, Marilyn Miller, Lydia Miller, Joel Donahue
Contains some b&w images

results.title: The Watchers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Cath Moore, Joe Weatherstone and Steven McGregor
results.brief_description: In a world where all our desires are monitored, a teenage boy is inspired to cross the line. But The Watchers are out and they show him where his actions may lead. Cast: Wayne Pygram, Dane Sheddon, Nathaniel Dean, Wayne Blair. 35mm live action footage with digital effects created on SGI, Mac and PC. Original format 35 mm/colour.

results.title: Warm strangers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Melanie Coombs and Ivan Sen
results.brief_description: At the end of his journey, Jess attempts to reunite with his father whom he has not seen for years. Powerful short from the director of ‘Beneath Clouds’ (2002), Produced by Melanie Coombs (‘Harvey Krumpet’). Original format 16mm/black and white.
results.description: At the end of his journey, Jess attempts to reunite with his father whom he has not seen for years. Powerful short from the director of ‘Beneath Clouds’ (2002), Produced by Melanie Coombs (‘Harvey Krumpet’). Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: True justice?
results.brief_description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.
results.description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.
description_for_label: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.

results.title: The Third note
results.creator_credit: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Priscilla Collins, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A blind woman and her Russian neighbour do battle with sound and music when he refuses to read a postcard for her. What starts as war ends in understanding.
Cast: Deborah Mailman, Leonid Dobrinski

Cast: Deborah Mailman, Leonid Dobrinski
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Priscilla Collins, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.description:
A blind woman and her Russian neighbour do battle with sound and music when he refuses to read a postcard for her. What starts as war ends in understanding.
Cast: Deborah Mailman, Leonid Dobrinski

results.title: The Road home
results.creator_credit: Robert Nugent, Kelrick Martin and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Documentary about Roy Read who was raised an orphan and told he wasn’t Aboriginal - just “darker than others”. At Kinchela Boys’ Home he was subjected to the horrors of institutionalised life. Now 49 years later, he returns to face the demons of his past - and reconnect with the family he never knew he had. Contains archival b&w stills
results.description: Documentary about Roy Read who was raised an orphan and told he wasn’t Aboriginal - just “darker than others”. results.title: Redreaming the dark
results.creator_credit: Romaine Moreton, Charlotte Seymour, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
During an electricity blackout in the family apartment, a young intellectually challenged Black woman has her life suddenly thrown into turmoil. Her grandmother soothes the young girl, teaching her not only to embrace the dark but also to love her dark self. Together the three women “redream” the dark.
Cast: Emily Walker, Leah Purcell, Irma Woods
results.creator_credit_for_label: Romaine Moreton, Charlotte Seymour, Erica Glynn and AFTRS

results.title: Range of experience
results.creator_credit: Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
It is the future - a world where the ability to experience life’s basic emotions has been lost to humanity and Virtual Reality has replaced dreams. The company Range of Experience Productions Inc has invented the Dream Base Selector, a machine which enables users to re-live experiences once created naturally by the subconscious mind. But it soon becomes apparent that the technology is slightly faulty…
Cast: Soledad Cordeaux

results.title: Midas
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Isabel Perez and Niki Bern
results.brief_description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.
results.description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.
description_for_label: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.
